data.name: This setting only applies to using the internal comment system, it does not impact Disqus comments.
data.value: This setting only applies to using the internal comment system, it does not impact Disqus comments.

data.name: Provide your Disqus site name aka short name to use Disqus instead of the internal comment system. Highly recommended.
data.value: Provide your Disqus site name aka short name to use Disqus instead of the internal comment system. Highly recommended.

data.name: Show About box in side bar of the blog.
data.value: Show About box in side bar of the blog.

data.name: Show related posts in the blog side bar based on categories of the current post.
data.value: Show related posts in the blog side bar based on categories of the current post.

data.name: Blog Menu Links To Newest Post
data.value: Blog Menu Links To Newest Post

data.name: Absolute string lenth including white space
data.value: Absolute string lenth including white space

data.name: Show Recent Posts on Default Page
data.value: Show Recent Posts on Default Page

data.name: Show Featured Posts on Default Page
data.value: Show Featured Posts on Default Page

data.name: The description also is used as the channel description in the RSS feed.
data.value: The description also is used as the channel description in the RSS feed.

data.name: If checked will show the blog title and description at the top of the post list.
data.value: If checked will show the blog title and description at the top of the post list.

data.name: The heading for the about box in the blog side panel.
data.value: The heading for the about box in the blog side panel.

data.name: A comma separated list of navigation component filter names used to filter the blog out of the menu. Leave this blank so the blog menu item is not filtered from any of the menu views. There are some standard filter names like topnav and breadcrumbs but it is also possible to use custom names with custom views. As soon as you populate this field it becomes filtered to only show the blog menu item in the included views, whereas blank means unfiltered.
data.value: A comma separated list of navigation component filter names used to filter the blog out of the menu. Leave this blank so the blog menu item is not filtered from any of the menu views. There are some standard filter names like topnav and breadcrumbs but it is also possible to use custom names with custom views. As soon as you populate this field it becomes filtered to only show the blog menu item in the included views, whereas blank means unfiltered.

data.name: Add the blog as a top level menu item. There are multiple other ways of adding the blog to the menu. You can make a page that links to /blog or it can be done from the navigation.xml file. If you see it in the menu more than once it means you have multiple ways it is configured to be added.
data.value: Add the blog as a top level menu item. There are multiple other ways of adding the blog to the menu. You can make a page that links to /blog or it can be done from the navigation.xml file. If you see it in the menu more than once it means you have multiple ways it is configured to be added.

data.name: If checked the blog menu item will link to the most recent post instead of the post list.
data.value: If checked the blog menu item will link to the most recent post instead of the post list.

data.name: The position of the blog within the top level menu.
data.value: The position of the blog within the top level menu.

data.name: Number of posts to show per page on the post list.
data.value: Number of posts to show per page on the post list.

data.name: If ON, truncated 'teasers' will automatically be generated for blog list views and RSS feed, and a read more link will be shown. You can overide the auto generated teaser per post with a manually created teaser
data.value: If ON, truncated 'teasers' will automatically be generated for blog list views and RSS feed, and a read more link will be shown. You can overide the auto generated teaser per post with a manually created teaser

data.name: Truncate blog posts in lists views and in the feed by character/word/length. Words is recommended.
data.value: Truncate blog posts in lists views and in the feed by character/word/length. Words is recommended.

data.name: Length (character/word/length) to truncate blog posts for teasers.
data.value: Length (character/word/length) to truncate blog posts for teasers.

data.name: This is used in meta data, see http://schema.org/publisher.
data.value: This is used in meta data, see http://schema.org/publisher.

data.name: This is used in meta data, see http://schema.org/logo.
data.value: This is used in meta data, see http://schema.org/logo.

data.name: Site Name is used in meta data.
data.value: Site Name is used in meta data.

data.name: This is used in meta data.
data.value: This is used in meta data.

data.name: Number of posts to show in the feed by default.
data.value: Number of posts to show in the feed by default.

data.name: Maximum number of posts to show in the feed. Used to constrain the query string paramter for feed size.
data.value: Maximum number of posts to show in the feed. Used to constrain the query string paramter for feed size.

data.name: You can edit this from Administration > Content Settings
data.value: You can edit this from Administration > Content Settings

data.name: If you want to view or submit comments you must accept the cookie consent.
data.value: If you want to view or submit comments you must accept the cookie consent.

data.name: You are currently viewing a draft version of this post.
data.value: You are currently viewing a draft version of this post.

data.name: To publish later you must enter a date.
data.value: To publish later you must enter a date.

data.name: On public pages, meta description is very important to search engines. It should be no longer than 135 – 160 characters long (although Google has recently been testing longer snippets). Any longer and search engines will chop the end off, so make sure any important keywords are nearer the front.
data.value: On public pages, meta description is very important to search engines. It should be no longer than 135 – 160 characters long (although Google has recently been testing longer snippets). Any longer and search engines will chop the end off, so make sure any important keywords are nearer the front.

data.name: Are you sure you want to delete the post {0}?
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the post {0}?

data.name: This content is scheduled to be published {0}. You can still edit and save changes to this draft before it is published by clicking "Save Draft"
data.value: This content is scheduled to be published {0}. You can still edit and save changes to this draft before it is published by clicking "Save Draft"

data.name: A previous version of this post has been restored to the editor, replacing the current draft version. If this is not intended, do not save/publish this version.
data.value: A previous version of this post has been restored to the editor, replacing the current draft version. If this is not intended, do not save/publish this version.

data.name: You've just restored a previously deleted post to the editor; click save/publish to re-create the post. If this is not intended, do not save/publish this version.
data.value: You've just restored a previously deleted post to the editor; click save/publish to re-create the post. If this is not intended, do not save/publish this version.

data.name: A previous version of this post has been restored to the editor. If this is not intended, do not save/publish this version.
data.value: A previous version of this post has been restored to the editor. If this is not intended, do not save/publish this version.

data.name: If checked, then show entire blog post on index/listing pages regardless of teaser settings.
data.value: If checked, then show entire blog post on index/listing pages regardless of teaser settings.

data.name: You are currently viewing a previous version of this post that was archived
data.value: You are currently viewing a previous version of this post that was archived

data.name: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this version history item?
data.value: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this version history item?

data.name: New Post with Standard Content Editor
data.value: New Post with Standard Content Editor

data.name: Are you sure you want to unpublish the post {0}?
data.value: Are you sure you want to unpublish the post {0}?

data.name: This is the published version, but this post has an unpublished draft.
data.value: This is the published version, but this post has an unpublished draft.

data.name: With great power comes great responsibility. This page is intended for use by developers, for adding javscript and css into the page. Use this page only if you understand what you are doing.
data.value: With great power comes great responsibility. This page is intended for use by developers, for adding javscript and css into the page. Use this page only if you understand what you are doing.

data.name: You are currently viewing a draft version of this page.
data.value: You are currently viewing a draft version of this page.

data.name: No Content Only Show Child Menu
data.value: No Content Only Show Child Menu

data.name: This is the heading and title of the page. For new pages the url slug will be generated based on the title.
data.value: This is the heading and title of the page. For new pages the url slug will be generated based on the title.

data.name: The slug is the url segment that will be used to link to this page. It is recommended to leave the slug blank when creating new pages, the slug will be generated based on the Page Heading. Slugs should be lower case and any characters that are not allowed in urls will be automatically removed.
data.value: The slug is the url segment that will be used to link to this page. It is recommended to leave the slug blank when creating new pages, the slug will be generated based on the Page Heading. Slugs should be lower case and any characters that are not allowed in urls will be automatically removed.

data.name: A page becomes a child page of another page if you enter the slug of the other page as the parent slug. The menu hierarchy is determined by the parent child relationship between pages. If you enter an invalid parent slug it will be ignored but will not cause any error. You can also manage the hierarchy from the Page Manager.
data.value: A page becomes a child page of another page if you enter the slug of the other page as the parent slug. The menu hierarchy is determined by the parent child relationship between pages. If you enter an invalid parent slug it will be ignored but will not cause any error. You can also manage the hierarchy from the Page Manager.

data.name: If you populate this field with an url then the page is used only as a means to add the url as a menu item. The page content in that case is not used or visible to users. You can use a relative url or a fully qualified url so it can link to external sites. Use this with caution and note that once populated the only way to edit the page is from the link in Page Manager.
data.value: If you populate this field with an url then the page is used only as a means to add the url as a menu item. The page content in that case is not used or visible to users. You can use a relative url or a fully qualified url so it can link to external sites. Use this with caution and note that once populated the only way to edit the page is from the link in Page Manager.

data.name: On most pages you will prbably want the page heading to show, but maybe not on the home page. If unchecked then the page heading will not be shown.
data.value: On most pages you will prbably want the page heading to show, but maybe not on the home page. If unchecked then the page heading will not be shown.

data.name: If the page is a parent of other pages, you check this box to make it show a menu of links to the child pages.
data.value: If the page is a parent of other pages, you check this box to make it show a menu of links to the child pages.

data.name: If you don't want to use the HTML WYSIWYG editor check this box. This would be useful if you are embedding javascript and application style markup.
data.value: If you don't want to use the HTML WYSIWYG editor check this box. This would be useful if you are embedding javascript and application style markup.

data.name: Check this box if the current page is only meant as a parent container for other pages and has no content of it's own.
data.value: Check this box if the current page is only meant as a parent container for other pages and has no content of it's own.

data.name: This is the sort order of this page within it's subtree of the menu. You can also move pages around easily from Page Manager, which will update the page order.
data.value: This is the sort order of this page within it's subtree of the menu. You can also move pages around easily from Page Manager, which will update the page order.

data.name: Leave blank to include this page in all menu views. A comma separated list of menu filter names can be used to filter the page out of the various menu views. For example enter breadcrumbs to leave a page out of other views but keep it in breadcrumbs. Standard menu filter names include: topnav,breadcrumbs,childtree. If you want to exclude a page from all menus, just use a non existent view name like 'none'.
data.value: Leave blank to include this page in all menu views. A comma separated list of menu filter names can be used to filter the page out of the various menu views. For example enter breadcrumbs to leave a page out of other views but keep it in breadcrumbs. Standard menu filter names include: topnav,breadcrumbs,childtree. If you want to exclude a page from all menus, just use a non existent view name like 'none'.

data.name: Leave View Roles blank for public pages. You can put comma separated role names here to make a page visible only to users who are role members.
data.value: Leave View Roles blank for public pages. You can put comma separated role names here to make a page visible only to users who are role members.

data.name: Are you sure you want to delete the page {0}?
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the page {0}?

data.name: Leave blank to include this page in all menu views. A comma separated list of menu filter names can be used to filter the page out of the various menu views. For example enter breadcrumbs to leave a page out of other views but keep it in breadcrumbs. Standard menu filter names include: topnav,breadcrumbs,childtree. If you want to exclude a page from all menus, just use a non existent view name like 'none'
data.value: Leave blank to include this page in all menu views. A comma separated list of menu filter names can be used to filter the page out of the various menu views. For example enter breadcrumbs to leave a page out of other views but keep it in breadcrumbs. Standard menu filter names include: topnav,breadcrumbs,childtree.
